intro: Macrolobium flexuosum var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered macrolobium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically small and yellow with five petals. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
